newsitem.title: USA: Bay Networks buys Rapid City.
newsitem.headline: Bay Networks buys Rapid City.

text.p: Bay Networks Inc said Thursday it had signed a definitive agreement to buy privately held Rapid City Communications for about $155 million in Bay stock.
Under the agreement, the Bay stock will be issued in exchange for all outstanding shares of Rapid City, including the obligations of outstanding Rapid City stock options.
Bay said it expects to recognize substantially all of the acquisition price as an unspecified one-time charge for in-process technology.

Rapid City, based in Mountain View, Calif., develops Gigabit Ethernet and routing switch technologies. Its chief executive, Joe Kennedy, will serve as a vice president of Bay, and Rapid City will become part of Bay's Enterprise Business Group, Bay said in a press release.
